Authors: María Mónica Ponce, María Amalia Scataglini
Title:
FILOGENIA Y REVISIÓN DEL GÉNERO CHEILANTHES (PTERIDACEAE) EN
AMÉRICA DEL SUR
Journal: Annals of the Missouri Botanical Garden
Keywords:
Cheilanthes, cheilanthoids, South America, taxonomy,
phylogeny, rbcL
Abstract:
A taxonomic revision of Cheilanthes from South America and
a phylogenetic analysis of the genus, based in morphological and
molecular data, including a representative amount of species from South
Cone, are presented. In the phylogenetic study, the polyphyly of
Cheilanthes was corrobrated and new groups for South American species
were proposed. The taxonomic treatment included diagnostic descriptions
and a key to determinate 44 species. Two new combinations, Cheilanthes
solitaria (R. M. Tryon) Ponce and Adiantopsis flexuosa (Kunze) Ponce
& Scataglini, were established; likewise C. regularis Kunze ex Mett.
was recognized within Adiantopsis. Also identity of unclear taxa was
resolved and updated synonyms were given, performing lectotypifications
in Notholaena rufa var. minor C. Presl; Notholaena rufa var. major C.
Presl; Cheilanthes fraseri Mett. ex Kuhn; Acrostichum glaucum Cav.;
Cheilanthes hieronymi Herter; Cheilanthes marginata var. gracilis
Hieron.; Cheilanthes thellungii Herter; Cheilanthes pohliana Kunze ex
Mett. and Cheilanthes flexuosa Kunze.
